>
> Kyo-kinko is non-Goto (non-Mino, etc.)=
 kinko work from after the Momoyama
> period. It is often applied to work t=
hat is in Goto style but is not Goto
> main or sideline work. Edo-kinko use=
d to be used similarly for work in the
> style of Edo region machibori kink=
o schools, but lately this is generally
> lumped as "Kyo-kinko" as well. So=
 it truly is a grab bag, but the problem
> (especially with menuki) is that=
 there is so much Edo period kinko 
> work with
> no unique character to it=
 that makes it possible to give a more specific
> attribution.
>
> BTW, gen=
eric Edo period kinko work of lower quality than Kyo-kinko is
> attributed =
to Kyo-kanagushi.
>
> Jim
